channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: Predatory publishers email everyone who posts preprints. I would think that Gmail would be better at filtering those out by now, but I still get multiple per week and have to make new filters for them manually. There are so many predatory publishers because the model works-- they make money-- unfortunately.

item.title: Dr Tim Nicholls
item.description: I'm old. How old? So old that I still can't bring myself to put a space in a filename.

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: American Ninja Warrior is quality TV. Amazing athletes. No head injuries/ CTE. No multimillionaires. More drama and emotion than the Olympics. And pyrotechnics.

item.title: nature :press:
item.description: Scientists celebrate as UK rejoins Horizon Europe research programmeNature, Published online: 07 September 2023; doi:10.1038/d41586-023-02812-1UK researchers had been frozen out of the scheme for two years, amid disagreements over Brexit. #presshttps://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-023-02812-1?utm_source=press.coop

item.title: The Viking
item.description:
@vineettiruvadi @kordinglab
This is an interesting perspective (from both of you).I'm not sure though I follow the criticism wrt systems ID vs reverse engineering. In engineering, systems ID always cares about the the overall systems behavior. This is in fact the critical goal, e.g. in systems ID for control. But you want to know something about the components that enable the overall behavior, e.g. in engineering bc you might be able to control some components to achieve a desired overall behavior. So really to me SID is one powerful way to RE... and I think their definition is appropriate in the presented context.That being said, it could have been clearer that this is not just a blue brain project of C. elegans... but that the overarching goal is indeed to reverse engineer the overall system's (i.e. animals) behavior as a function of its constituents. This is at least partially mentioned when they talk about wanting to understand sub-system function and building blocks of behavior. So maybe that's where some of the conceptual confusion comes from?

item.title: Chemjobber
item.description: Cheeky Scientist is a bad company that should be stopped. Academic friends, please contact your department/school's career services and ask them to stop booking Isaiah Hankel or his company. Read this important article by Catherine Offord, and pass it on https://www.science.org/content/article/criticism-builds-against-ph-d-careers-firm-cheeky-scientist
